extendedIngredients.name: carrot
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 carrot, cut into matchsticks or grated

extendedIngredients.name: cucumber
extendedIngredients.originalString: ½ cucumber, peeled, deseeded and cut into matchsticks

extendedIngredients.name: red chilli
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 small red chilli, deseeded and finely chopped

extendedIngredients.name: tiger prawns
extendedIngredients.originalString: 150g pack cooked tiger prawns, halved along their spine

recipes.title: Vietnamese prawn salad

winePairing.pairingText: Fish works really well with Pinot Grigio, Gruener Veltliner, and Pinot Noir. Fish is as diverse as wine, so it's hard to pick wines that go with every fish. A crisp white wine, such as a pinot grigio or Grüner Veltliner, will suit any delicately flavored white fish. Meaty, strongly flavored fish such as salmon and tuna can even handle a light red wine, such as a pinot noir. The Vampire Pinot Grigio Wine with a 4.5 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 18 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Vampire Pinot Grigio Wine
productMatches.description: This dry, zestful combination is reminiscent of ripe pears and roses

recipes.instructions: To make the dressing, mash the garlic,chilli and sugar using a pestle and mortar.Add the lime juice and 3 tbsp water andstir together. Set aside.Get the kettle on, put the noodles intoa bowl, then cover with boiling water.Leave to stand for 10 mins until tender,then drain and divide between 2 bowls.3 Mix the prawns and veg together anddivide between the bowls, too. Finish bytopping each salad with the herbs andpeanuts, then pour over the dressingto serve.

steps.step: To make the dressing, mash the garlic,chilli and sugar using a pestle and mortar.

Add the lime juice and 3 tbsp water andstir together. Set aside.Get the kettle on, put the noodles intoa bowl, then cover with boiling water.Leave to stand for 10 mins until tender,then drain and divide between 2 bowls.3
Mix the prawns and veg together anddivide between the bowls, too. Finish bytopping each salad with the herbs andpeanuts, then pour over the dressingto serve.
